metadata.title: CVE-2019-12735 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
getchar.c in Vim before 8.1.1365 and Neovim before 0.3.6 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary OS commands via the :source! command in amodeline, as demonstrated by execute in Vim, and assert_fails or nvim_inputin Neovim.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-athena - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-gnome - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-gtk - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-gui-common - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-nox - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-runtime - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
vim-tiny - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
xxd - 2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: neovim: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
vim package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.0.1453-1ubuntu1.1').
